intro_only_event_swsh_advertise_1/6001_1:
If you talk to the other Trainers on Pasio, you get
to hear how different the leagues are in all the
other regions! It’s some interesting stuff!

Take the Galar region, for example.
Most of their Pokémon Gyms are huge stadiums
where spectators can enjoy watching the battles.

Once a year, Trainers in Galar compete in a
tournament for the chance to battle the Champion,
and the whole thing is televised for everybody!

Man, I’m getting pumped up just thinking about it!
Once we win here on Pasio, let’s go try our hand
in Galar, too!
intro_only_event_swsh_advertise_1/6003_1:
Since coming to Pasio, I’ve learned a ton of new
stuff about dragon Pokémon from the dragon
masters here.

Turns out there are a bunch of Pokémon all over
the world that I’ve never even seen before.

The one I want to see most is a Steel-type
Pokémon called Duraludon! You can find it
in the Galar region.

I heard that even though Duraludon’s body is made
of heavy-looking metal, it’s actually really, really
lightweight! I wonder what it’s like in person...
intro_only_event_swsh_advertise_1/6004_1:
There are so many stylish people on Pasio—it’s
tons of fun just to people watch!

Oh, speaking of stylish, I made a new friend from
Kalos the other day. She’s super knowledgeable
about all the latest fashion trends!

According to her, the boutiques in the Galar region
carry all kinds of different clothing brands!

They let you try out everything in the store to mix
and match your entire outfit! You can also go to
salons and get your hair and makeup done!

I can’t wait to visit Galar someday and dive into
all the fashion and beauty trends there!
intro_only_event_swsh_advertise_1/6005_1:
I spend lots of time skating all around Pasio,
practicing my tricks.

It’s so much fun! The sights and smells are all so
different from Kalos that everything feels new
and fresh!

Oh, speaking of fresh, have you heard of the
Wild Area in Galar? Apparently, it’s full of really
big, open fields.

I wonder what they’re like! I’d totally love to run
wild with Lucario there someday!
intro_only_event_swsh_advertise_1/6006_1:
Pasio is a great place to experience all sorts of
regional cuisines, thanks to the variety of dishes
and cooking ingredients imported here.

A chef I ran into told me that curry is very popular
in the Galar region.

Apparently, cooking a pot of curry when one goes
camping has become something of a tradition
there. I’m curious how that tradition started.

It’s all certainly intriguing! If I ever have the
opportunity to visit the region, I’d like to try
making my own original curry recipe.
intro_only_event_swsh_advertise_1/6007_1:
I traveled with a Zigzagoon back on Hoenn that
always came through for me in a pinch. His Cut
could slice through anything!

Speaking of Zigzagoon, my dad told me that in the
Galar region they look different from the ones we
usually see.

I hear they like to battle but have a cute
side and like to play with people, too.

And get this! They can apparently evolve a
second time—after evolving into Linoone!
Isn’t that awesome?!

I wonder what they look like.
I’d love to see one someday!
If we can, let’s go together!
intro_only_event_swsh_advertise_1/6008_1:
You know I’m in a band, right? We have an
awesome stage in my Gym, and we have a big
Koffing painted on the wall behind it!

Koffing and Weezing look totally sick, don’t they?
I think they’re rad!

Oh yeah, have you heard of the Galar region?
Apparently, they got a Weezing that’s different
from the ones we got in Unova.

It’s got smokestack-looking things on its head that
filter the air and make it clean.

Talk about unexpected, right? Bet you woulda
never guessed that comin’ from a Weezing!

It’d be awesome if we could go catch a few
together someday! I might get some ideas for
new songs, too!
intro_only_event_swsh_advertise_1/6009_1:
Clashing with mighty opponents head on, testing
each other’s mettle, and prevailing over them is
what makes both Trainers and Pokémon stronger!

I’ve heard that Farfetch’d in the Galar region can
achieve quite a unique Evolution if they can prove
their mettle through countless battles.

They become Sirfetch’d, a noble Pokémon that uses
a giant leek as a lance to do honorable battle
with any opponent that dares challenge it!

I can sympathize with that principle! I would love
to encounter one someday.
When that day comes, you shall be at my side!
